page.title: 13 Parker's Patch
page.content: Parker's Patch is the name of my house. It's got three bedrooms and two loos with 13 windows and an ancient fire place that was there at the time of Roland Parker who was the Head Master in the village school in 1875. He was also the choirmaster and organist of the parish. The house is about 20 steps up from the school and 10 steps down from the Post Office which is owned by Mr. Rutterford. We moved into the house in December 1984. There are 4 rooms down stairs and 5 rooms up stairs. In the garden there's a fishpond and a green house. In the kitchen there's a toaster, a washing machine, a tumble drier and a fridge with floor and wall cupboards along the sides. I live there with my mummy, Alastair and Elizabeth.
